claim: Across the 2007–2009 seasons, the race completion rate for Japanese F1 drivers was approximately 27.2727%.
extra_info: from 2007 to 2009 refers to year between 2007 and 2009; race completion refers to time is not null; percentage = Divide(COUNT(DriverID where time is not null and year between 2007 and 2009),Count (DriverID where year between 2007 and 2009))*100;
reasoning: The database shows that Japanese F1 drivers had 18 race completions (time IS NOT NULL) out of 66 total race entries in the 2007-2009 seasons, yielding a completion rate of 27.2727...%, which matches the claimed approximate value of 27.2727%.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE results
(
    resultId        INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId          INTEGER default 0  not null,
    driverId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    constructorId   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    number          INTEGER,
    grid            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    position        INTEGER,
    positionText    TEXT    default '' not null,
    positionOrder   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    points          REAL   default 0  not null,
    laps            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    time            TEXT,
    milliseconds    INTEGER,
    fastestLap      INTEGER,
    rank            INTEGER default 0,
    fastestLapTime  TEXT,
    fastestLapSpeed TEXT,
    statusId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId),
    foreign key (statusId) references status(statusId)
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),

content.text: Good. Now let me query for Japanese drivers' race completion rate across 2007-2009.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" "
SELECT 
    COUNT(CASE WHEN r.time IS NOT NULL THEN d.driverId END) AS completed,
    COUNT(d.driverId) AS total,
    CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN r.time IS NOT NULL THEN d.driverId END) AS REAL) / COUNT(d.driverId) * 100 AS completion_rate
FROM results r
JOIN races ra ON r.raceId = ra.raceId
JOIN drivers d ON r.driverId = d.driverId
WHERE d.nationality = 'Japanese'
  AND ra.year BETWEEN 2007 AND 2009;
"
input.description: Calculate race completion rate for Japanese drivers 2007-2009

content.text:
The query results show:
- **Completed races** (time IS NOT NULL): 18
- **Total race entries**: 66
- **Completion rate**: 27.2727272727273%

The claim states the rate was "approximately 27.2727%", and the actual computed value is 27.2727...% (repeating), which is 18/66. This matches the claim precisely.
